title: So if I change my behavior in league will any previous bans count?
body:
So, yes I do admit it I was being very toxic. (intentional feeding)  Though I have 2 questions in mind, If I change my behavior in league will any previous bans count? Also what if a person just reports me for the ''lols'' will I be banned or will it be reviewed?

Do you think there should be a new ban/report system?
https://goo.gl/BJhjix

replies.body:
If you have been toxic and/or inting then yes you will still be punished for past offences.  If you are talking about future offences then yes their is a lower ceiling for you to be punished again vs someone who has never been punished.  If you are talking about a new account then (unless you got a ban like tyler1) you wont be followed to the new account and will start fresh.

If someone reports for the "lols" then it wont ban you.  Even if you still have a lower ceiling for punishments unless it is actually toxic/inting then no you won't be banned (side note, if you report without it actually being an offence then you are just lowering the weight the system gives your report, frequent misreporting pretty much results in it becoming useless)

In the unlikely event that you DO get banned and it wasn't an legitimate ban then you can send riot a ticket and it will be reviewed and rescinded.

Thank you very much, you have answered my question.

Just be seriously careful about what content makes a ban "count".
There's a bunch of really PG stuff that makes you "toxic".

There is a post here somewhere about what stuff it counts- check it out!
To expand on this: either don't type in chat at all or just kiss as much ass as possible. Even saying "please don't gank" can get you reported...

Will previous bans count if you've reformed?  Yes and no.

No, in the sense that if you have done nothing reportworthy, than those reports will be discarded.  Same as for someone with a clean account

Yes, in that if you slip enough for a new punishment, your previous ones will dictate which level the next one will be at.

However, if you consistantly show reformed behavior, your account can be brought back into a clean state.  But it'll take time and consistant play.  Last I heard, roughly 3 months to move back 1 tier.  That translates to about 9 months to clear after a 2-week ban.

I never asked if I needed psychiatric help or not, I am just trying to learn how the ban system works so I can improve and become a non-toxic person.

They use a tier system

1st punishment- 10 game chat restriction
2nd punishment- 25 game chat restriction
3rd punishment- Two week ban
4th punishment- Perma

Certain things can cause escalated punishment - racism, telling people to kill themselves, intentionally feeding, stuff like that.

It is possible to drop down the tier if you play often enough without getting reported. Riot won't tell anyone how many games it takes though, so you just have to keep playing without getting reported.

And there is no such thing as a "reform letter".
